item.title: Tea Forté Singapore presents three mooncake collections as part of the Autumn in Abundance series
item.description: Source: Tea Forté. Tea Forté Singapore, a specialty tea company, has introduced its new Autumn in Abundance mooncake collection, featuring traditional baked mooncakes with reduced sugar, the Creative Infused line, and a special Luxury selection. The company suggests pairing the traditional mooncakes with its organic white ginger pear tea, the Creative Infused collection with the organic green mango peach tea, and the Luxurious selections with its orchid vanilla tea.

item.title: Sparkle under the moonlight during an afternoon tea in Hong Kong this September
item.description: Source: The Langham, Hong Kong. The Twinkle in the Moonlight Afternoon Tea set. The Langham Hotel in Hong Kong is celebrating the Mid-Autumn Festival with a special afternoon tea inspired by Eastern flavors. Offered throughout September at the hotel’s Palm Court restaurant, the menu, created by Executive Pastry Chef David Puig, features treats like “The Moon,” a lychee and raspberry mousse cake decorated with a galaxy glaze. This dessert also includes rose essence, Sacher sponge cake, and a golden crescent moon topping.

item.title: Teabox shortens tea supply chain to deliver fresher teas to the market
item.description: Kaushal Dugar, CEO of Teabox, which launched in 2012, comes from a family with over 70 years in the tea industry. He started the company to revolutionize the tea trade. Source: Teabox. Dugar. “I’ve always been passionate about entrepreneurship,” Dugar shared, noting that the tea industry, valued at US$90 billion, uses outdated practices. He pointed out that while India is a top tea producer, its tea isn’t as renowned as tea from Japan or China.

item.title: Starbucks Teavana is now offered in the Asia Pacific region
item.description: Starbucks has launched Starbucks Teavana, its line of handcrafted tea drinks and whole leaf tea sachets, in over 6,200 stores across 16 markets in the China and Asia Pacific region. This marks the global availability of Starbucks Teavana. Starbucks Teavana offers unique, layered flavor experiences in both iced and hot formats. John Culver, Group President of Starbucks Global Retail, highlighted the growing consumer demand for new and unique taste experiences and positioned the Teavana launch as a way to leverage Starbucks’ expertise in crafting beverages and sourcing premium ingredients to become a leader in the tea category.

item.title: This year, Teardrop Hotels is introducing three new tea plantation experiences in Sri Lanka
item.description: Teardrop Hotels is expanding its portfolio in 2018 with the addition of three renovated tea planters’ houses: Goatfell, Nine Skies, and Pekoe House. These vintage managers’ bungalows, located along the tea country route, will offer a modern take on traditional tea plantation accommodations. Opening in April 2018, Goatfell is a former superintendent’s residence situated on a working tea estate above Nuwara Eliya. This four-bedroom main house, with two additional standalone chalets, boasts living and dining rooms and a swimming pool.

item.title: Are we consuming an excessive amount of aluminum?
item.description: Naan wrapped in aluminum foil. Concerns about aluminum in our diets have been rising since the mid-1960s when it was linked to Alzheimer’s disease. We encounter this metal from various sources, including cookware and clay dishes used for cooking or storing food, aluminum packaging, and even naturally occurring aluminum in foods like tea. Additionally, some foods contain aluminum-based additives, such as those found in baked goods. Indeed, everyday foods like cake and tea can contribute to your daily aluminum intake.

item.title: Selecting the appropriate tea for the workplace break room
item.description: It’s common to find pre-mixed tea sachets or teabags in office pantries. While these are convenient and widely available, Teabox, an online retailer specializing in premium Indian teas, suggests there might be downsides to these options. Source: Teabox website. Teabox CEO, Kaushal Dugar, explains that tea dust, a byproduct of tea production, lacks the full flavor, taste, and aroma of whole tea leaves. This tea dust is often what ends up in teabags, resulting in a less flavorful and potentially less nutritious cup.

item.title: Toyo Koda will enhance the menus at Le Passage Mohkan Shan
item.description: Source: Le Passage Mohkan Shan website. Le Passage Mohkan Shan, a French-style hotel and restaurant nestled in its own private tea plantation at the base of Moganshan* mountain in China, has appointed Toyo Koda as its new head chef. This strategic hire emphasizes the hotel’s aim to become a premier culinary destination in Asia. Chef Toyo, previously recognized as one of Asia’s top chefs by the San Pellegrino Restaurant Awards in 2013 for his role at Shanghai’s French restaurant Franck, is poised to transform the hotel’s culinary offerings.
